Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a plant that is healthy and growing with water and light. This includes details like vibrant green leaves and visible growth structures.
The student can draw a plant that is not healthy when it lacks water, showing signs like wilted or drooping leaves.
The student can draw a plant that is not healthy when it lacks light, possibly depicting pale or yellowing leaves.
The student can represent how patterns show that plants need water to survive by effectively drawing a comparison of plants with and without water, clearly highlighting the differences in appearance.

The student can represent how patterns show that plants need light to survive by drawing a comparison of plants with and without light, demonstrating the impact on plant health through colors and structure.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally overlook minor details, such as forgetting to label one of the plants or inconsistently coloring (e.g., sometimes forgetting to show yellowing in leaves lacking light).

The student might show minor inconsistencies in representing time progression, such as not uniformly showing growth stages across different conditions (e.g., advanced growth in one healthy plant but only initial growth in another).
